overview_of_class: This course will survey central topics in microeconomic theory that are typically not reached in 310-1. The emphasis is on elementary presentation of some of the main ideas of modern microeconomics. Among the topics covered are: social choice theory, applications of elementary game theory, general equilibrium in perfectly competitive markets and the economic consequences of uncertainty and imperfect information.
name: Microeconomics
title: WCAS ECON 310-2-20 Microeconomics

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course will survey central topics in microeconomic theory that are typically not reached in 310-1. The emphasis is on elementary presentation of some of the main ideas of modern microeconomics. Among the topics covered are: social choice theory, applications of elementary game theory, general equilibrium in perfectly competitive markets and the economic consequences of uncertainty and imperfect information.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Econ 310-1, Math 214-1 and 2 or their equivalent.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Two 80-minute lectures and a 1-hour discussion section per week.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Weekly homework, two midterms and one final exam.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: There is no required textbook for the course. Your 310-1 textbook is likely to have some rudimentary coverage of most of the topics in the course. However, since the lectures are the primary source for the course, you can manage without any textbook.
